body:
Oh hang on, your source file is not inside GOPATH. When you do go get ./...
Your source file, the one you are expecting to define the root of the
dependency tree that Go get will download is not visible to the go tool. In
that case I have no idea what it's trying to fetch.

Bottom line, if you want to use go get, you'll have to lay our your source
in the format it expects. I'm sorry if this is inconvenient but its just
the way it is, the go tool eschews flags and options for an enforced
convention.

On Fri, 5 Feb 2016, 19:39 arogarth <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi,
>
> the same happens...
>
> /ARO
